page.title: 14The Hunt.
page.content: The Minehead Harriers have their kennels in Huntsham, between Timberscombe and Wooton Courtenay.The kennels used to be in Minehead but in 1956 they moved to Huntsham and rented it from Mr. Gooding. In 1965 Miss Lumb bought the kennels and gave it to the Harriers as their permanent home. The hunt covers 33 square miles from Dunster to Wheddon Cross, Bladgon Cross to Webbers Post, Horner to Porlock.They start hunting cubs in September but they really start to hunt in November. They hunt from November to March. They hunt twice a week, on Wednesday and Saturday. The subscription is $75.00 a year.
